      • createMenuItem

        private javafx.scene.control.MenuItem createMenuItem(java.lang.String txtLbl,
                                                     javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> e)
        Returns a MenuItem with txtLbl text, and a event when you action click it
        Parameters:
        txtLbl - the text you want the menu item to display
        e - the event you want to happen when you click the menu item
        Returns:
        the MenuItem with txtLbl and e event

      • createMenu_Structure

        private javafx.scene.layout.FlowPane createMenu_Structure(javafx.scene.control.Menu menu,
                                                          javafx.scene.image.Image btnImg,
                                                          java.lang.String txtLbl,
                                                          double maxWidth,
                                                          double imgFitSize)
        Build a new FlowPane with an img and text (sets the menu object design)
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu you want to "design"
        btnImg - the icon you want to display in the menu object
        txtLbl - the text you want the menu to display
        maxWidth - the maximum width of the menu object
        imgFitSize - the size of the icon
        Returns:
        FlowPane with all the objects attached to it

      • createMenuItem

        private void createMenuItem(javafx.scene.control.Menu menu,
                            javafx.scene.image.Image btnImg,
                            java.lang.String txtLbl,
                            double maxWidth,
                            double imgFitSize)
        Creates a menu object that and adds it to the menu bar (not a clickable menu object)
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu object you want to add to the menu bar
        btnImg - the icon you want to display in the menu object
        txtLbl - the text you want the menu to display
        maxWidth - the maximum width of the menu object
        imgFitSize - the size of the icon

      • createMenuItem

        private void createMenuItem(javafx.scene.control.Menu menu,
                            javafx.scene.image.Image btnImg,
                            java.lang.String txtLbl,
                            double maxWidth,
                            double imgFitSize,
                            javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> e)
        Creates a clickable menu object and adds it to the menu bar
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu object you want to add to the menu bar
        btnImg - the icon you want to display in the menu object
        txtLbl - the text you want the menu to display
        maxWidth - the maximum width of the menu object
        imgFitSize - the size of the icon
        e - the event you want to happen when you click the menu object

      • getChangeScreenActionEvent

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> getChangeScreenActionEvent(java.lang.String screenName)
        Return an action event that switches between screens
        Parameters:
        screenName - the screen name you want to switch to
        Returns:
        action event of the screen switching
